reviewText: The above quote was the famous opening line to THE BOB CUMMINGS SHOW (aka "Love That Bob"). This half-hour CBS-TV sitcom aired from 1/9/55 to 7/7/59.Here, Ex-Air Force pilot Bob Cummings is a Beverly Hills based fashion photographer, Rosemary Ee Camp plays his sister Margaret and Ann B. Davis is secretary Schultzy, who loves her boss unrequitedly. As a result she often sabotages Bob's liasons with the many ladies and models he likes to dally with. Margaret is a busy surrogate mom to their younger brother Chuck (Dwayne Hickman), yet she still finds time to urge Bob toward settling down with one good woman.CONTENTS--(11/18/58) Bob in Orbit - Bob's grandpa (also Cummings) attacks the airbase in his antique plane. (guests: Lyle Talbot and Nancy Kulp.)(12/16/58) Bob Judges a Beauty Contest - Bob wants in on the Air Force's pulchritude pageant. (Guests: Peter Lawford., Rose Marie, Nancy Kulp.)_(9/30/58) Bob and the Dumb Blonde - Schultzy is jealous of Bob's Monroe lookalike temp secretary. (Guests: Lisa Gaye, Dorothy Johnson)DIGIVIEW's slimline cased DVDs feature unrestored public domain films and TV show episodes that have no subtitles or extras. Audio levels are some of the highest you'll find, which makes these ideal for laptop PC or portable disc player watching.
summary: "Smile! I think you're gonna like this picture!"
Title: N/A

reviewText: My first movie that I watched with Robert Cummings was Alfred Hitchcock's Saboteur (1942).  The I saw him in Dial M for Murder.  I have seen him in other movies.  But I never thought of him as a comedian.This show seemed so overly silly that it wasn't even that funny.  Some people may think it is funny.  But I was interested to see it as a fan of classic movies, TV, and radio.
summary: Silly show but interesting to watch

reviewText: AIRED ON TV 1955-1959A INTERESTING NOTE IS ANN B. DAVIS (ALICE, BRADY BUNCH) ALSO STARS AS THE LOVEABLE 'SHULTZY', BOB'S OFFICE ASSISTANT.1. BOB IN ORBIT - WACKY GRANDPA FLYS HIS PLANE AND BOMBS THE BASE WHICH CAUSES A BIG MESS FOR BOB. GREAT EPISODE WITH SPFX, QUITE GOOD FOR 1950'S B&W; TELEVISION SITCOMS.2. BOB JUDGES A BEAUTY CONTEST - THE BEST OF THE 3 EPISDOES ON THE DVD. STARS PETER LAWFORD, NANCY KULP - (AKA JANE HATHAWAY BEVERLY HILLBILLIES)IN A VERY HUMOROUS ROLE TRYING TO SEDUCE BOB WEARING SWIMWEAR.3. BOB AND THE DUMB BLONDE - SHULTZY ATTEMPTS TO SWAY BOB'S INTEREST IN HIS 'MARILYN MONROE-ISH' TEMPORARY SECRETARY.ENGLISH/BLACK & WHITE/INTERACTIVE MENUS/EPISODE SELECTION/PREVIEWS/75 MINUTES2004 DIGIVIEW DVDIN A THIN BLACK PLASTIC DVD CASE. (NOT A CARDBOARD FOLDER, AS SOME ARE.)
summary: THE BOB CUMMINGS SHOW / LOVE THAT BOB DVD [DIGIVIEW]

reviewText: THE BOB CUMMINGS SHOW (aka LOVE THAT BOB) was a sitcom from the late 1950's which was unusually "adult" for that era of wholesome family entertainment.  Robert Cummings stars as a playboy photographer always on the make after his beautiful models and whom women, both beautiful and character types, just can't resist.  Rosemary DeCamp and Dwayne Hickman costarred as his sister and nephew but the most notable member of the supporting cast was Ann B. Davis, a good dozen years before THE BRADY BUNCH, as his comic office assistant Schultzy, an Emmy-award winning role (alas none of the three episodes here really show Ann up to her best advantage).  The episodes here are:BOB IN ORBIT - Cummings may have been the first sitcom star to play a second semi-regular character on his show in disguise, here his feeble, eccentric Grandpa (in heavy makeup and a passable Walter Brennan dialect).  This episode is the weakest of the three on the disc as Grandpa gets Cummings in trouble with the Air Force.BOB JUDGES A BEAUTY CONTEST - Peter Lawford guest stars as himself in this episode where Bob tries to talk a General's wife out of wanting Lawford (one of his photography cilents) to judge a beauty contest sponsored by the Air Force and choose him for the job instead.  This one is enlivened by Nancy Kulp's very Miss Janeish turn as Pamela, the homely birdwatcher out on the prowl for Bob.  Another future sitcom icon, Rose Marie, is also featured as another secretary in the office building.BOB AND THE DUMB BLONDE - Schultzy's boyfriend is on shore leave so Bob's sister Rosemary gets dizzy blonde waitress Barbara Nichols to substitute for her even though Barbara has a history of chasing Bob, who at the moment trying to seduce a new highbrow British model.These episodes play like 1950's versions of THREE'S COMPANY with broad comedy, mugging, and a surprisingly strong dose of sex for an American television series of the era.  Bob Cummings himself alas is closer to your 8th grade science teacher than a Warren Beatty/George Clooney type playboy whom women can't resist but he is a pretty good comedian but he is no match for three great comediennes, Ann B. Davis and guest stars Kulp and Nichols who make this disc worth seeking out and owning.
summary: Like Bob But Love That Ann B. Davis, Nancy Kulp & Barbara Nichols
Title: N/A
